verses.english: Nun. By the pen and what they inscribe,
verses.hausa: Ñ. Na rantse da alƙalami da abin da (marubũta) suke rubũtãwa.

verses.english: You are not, [O Muhammad], by the favor of your Lord, a madman.
verses.hausa: Kai, sabõda ni'imar Ubangijinka, bã mahaukaci kake ba.

verses.english: And indeed, for you is a reward uninterrupted.
verses.hausa: Kuma, lalle, haƙĩƙa kanã da lãdar da bã ta yankewa.

verses.english: And indeed, you are of a great moral character.
verses.hausa: Kuma, lalle haƙiƙa kana a kan hãlãyen kirki, manya.

verses.english: So you will see and they will see
verses.hausa: Don haka, zã ka gani, sũ kuma zã su gani.

verses.english: Which of you is the afflicted [by a devil].
verses.hausa: Ga wanenku haukã take.

verses.arabic: إِنَّ رَبَّكَ هُوَ أَعْلَمُ بِمَن ضَلَّ عَن سَبِيلِهِۦ وَهُوَ أَعْلَمُ بِٱلْمُهْتَدِينَ
verses.english: Indeed, your Lord is most knowing of who has gone astray from His way, and He is most knowing of the [rightly] guided.
verses.hausa: Lalle Ubangijinka Shi ne Mafi sani ga wanda ya ɓace daga tafarkinSa. Kuma Shi ne Mafi sani ga mãsu shiryuwa.

verses.english: Then do not obey the deniers.
verses.hausa: Saboda haka kada ka bi mãsu ƙaryatãwa.

verses.english: They wish that you would soften [in your position], so they would soften [toward you].
verses.hausa: Sunã fatar ka sassauta, su kuma sũ sassauta.

verses.english: And do not obey every worthless habitual swearer
verses.hausa: Kada ka bi dukkan mai yawan rantsuwa, walãkantacce.

verses.english: [And] scorner, going about with malicious gossip -
verses.hausa: Mai zunɗe, mai yãwo da gulma.

verses.english: A preventer of good, transgressing and sinful,
verses.hausa: Mai hana alhẽri mai zãlunci, mai zunubi.

verses.english: Cruel, moreover, and an illegitimate pretender.
verses.hausa: Mai girman kai, bãyan haka kuma la'ĩmi (bã ya son alhẽri).

verses.english: Because he is a possessor of wealth and children,
verses.hausa: Sabõda yã kasance mai dũkiya da ɗiya.

verses.arabic: إِذَا تُتْلَىٰ عَلَيْهِ ءَايَـٰتُنَا قَالَ أَسَـٰطِيرُ ٱلْأَوَّلِينَ
verses.english: When Our verses are recited to him, he says, "Legends of the former peoples."
verses.hausa: Idan ana karanta masa ãyõyinMu, sai ya ce: "Tatsũniyõyin mutãnen farko ne."

verses.english: We will brand him upon the snout.
verses.hausa: Zã Mu yi masa alãma a kan hanci.

verses.arabic: إِنَّا بَلَوْنَـٰهُمْ كَمَا بَلَوْنَآ أَصْحَـٰبَ ٱلْجَنَّةِ إِذْ أَقْسَمُوا۟ لَيَصْرِمُنَّهَا مُصْبِحِينَ
verses.english: Indeed, We have tried them as We tried the companions of the garden, when they swore to cut its fruit in the [early] morning
verses.hausa: Lalle Mun jarrabe su kamar yadda Muka jarrabi mãsu gonar lambu, a lokacin da suka yi rantsuwa, wai lalle zã su girbe amfãninta, suna mãsu asubanci.

verses.english: Without making exception.
verses.hausa: Kuma (suka yi niyya), bã su kõ tõgẽwa.

verses.arabic: فَطَافَ عَلَيْهَا طَآئِفٌ مِّن رَّبِّكَ وَهُمْ نَآئِمُونَ
verses.english: So there came upon the garden an affliction from your Lord while they were asleep.
verses.hausa: Wani mai kẽwayãwa daga Ubangijinka ya kẽwayã a kanta, (ya ƙone ta,) alhãli sunã barci.

verses.english: And it became as though reaped.
verses.hausa: Sai ta wãyi gari (baƙa ƙirin) kamar dare.

verses.english: And they called one another at morning,
verses.hausa: Sai suka kirãyi jũna, sunã mãsu yin asubanci.

verses.arabic: أَنِ ٱغْدُوا۟ عَلَىٰ حَرْثِكُمْ إِن كُنتُمْ صَـٰرِمِينَ
verses.english: [Saying], "Go early to your crop if you would cut the fruit."
verses.hausa: Cẽwa ku yi sammakõ ga amfãnin gõnarku, idan kun kasance mãsu girbewa.

verses.english: So they set out, while lowering their voices,
verses.hausa: Sai suka tafi sunã shãwara a ɓõye (sunã cẽwa).

verses.arabic: أَن لَّا يَدْخُلَنَّهَا ٱلْيَوْمَ عَلَيْكُم مِّسْكِينٌ
verses.english: [Saying], "There will surely not enter it today upon you [any] poor person."
verses.hausa: "Lalle kada wani miskĩni ya shigar muku ita a yau!"

verses.english: And they went early in determination, [assuming themselves] able.
verses.hausa: Kuma suka yi sammako akan (niyyar) rõwa, matuƙar iyãwarsu.

verses.english: But when they saw it, they said, "Indeed, we are lost;
verses.hausa: Lõkacin da suka gan ta, sai suka ce: "Lalle, mun saki hanya (mun ɓace)!"

verses.english: Rather, we have been deprived."
verses.hausa: "Ba haka ba, mũ dai, an hana mu ne."

verses.arabic: قَالَ أَوْسَطُهُمْ أَلَمْ أَقُل لَّكُمْ لَوْلَا تُسَبِّحُونَ
verses.english: The most moderate of them said, "Did I not say to you, 'Why do you not exalt [Allah]?' "
verses.hausa: Mafificinsu (hankali) ya ce: "Ban gaya muku ba, yã kamata ku tsarkake Allah?"

verses.arabic: قَالُوا۟ سُبْحَـٰنَ رَبِّنَآ إِنَّا كُنَّا ظَـٰلِمِينَ
verses.english: They said, "Exalted is our Lord! Indeed, we were wrongdoers."
verses.hausa: Suka ce: "Tsarki ya tabbata ga Ubangijinmu! Lalle, mu mun kasance azzãlumai."

verses.english: Then they approached one another, blaming each other.
verses.hausa: Sai suka fuskanci jũna, sunã zargin kansu.

verses.english: They said, "O woe to us; indeed we were transgressors.
verses.hausa: Suka ce: "Kaitonmu! Lalle, mũ ne muka kasance mãsu ƙẽtare iyãka."

verses.arabic: عَسَىٰ رَبُّنَآ أَن يُبْدِلَنَا خَيْرًا مِّنْهَآ إِنَّآ إِلَىٰ رَبِّنَا رَٰغِبُونَ
verses.english: Perhaps our Lord will substitute for us [one] better than it. Indeed, we are toward our Lord desirous."
verses.hausa: "Mai yiwuwa ne Ubangijinmu Ya musanya mana da wani abu da yã fi ta. Lalle, mũ (ba mu yanke ƙauna ba) zuwa ga Ubangijinmu, mãsu kwaɗayi ne."

verses.arabic: كَذَٰلِكَ ٱلْعَذَابُ ۖ وَلَعَذَابُ ٱلْـَٔاخِرَةِ أَكْبَرُ ۚ لَوْ كَانُوا۟ يَعْلَمُونَ
verses.english: Such is the punishment [of this world]. And the punishment of the Hereafter is greater, if they only knew.
verses.hausa: Haka dai azãbar take, kuma lalle ne azãbar Lãhira ta fi girma, in da sun kasance zã su iya gãnẽwã.

verses.arabic: إِنَّ لِلْمُتَّقِينَ عِندَ رَبِّهِمْ جَنَّـٰتِ ٱلنَّعِيمِ
verses.english: Indeed, for the righteous with their Lord are the Gardens of Pleasure.
verses.hausa: Lalle ne mãsu taƙawa nã da a wurin Ubangijinsu, gidãjen Aljanna na ni'ima.

verses.english: Then will We treat the Muslims like the criminals?
verses.hausa: Shin ko zã Mu sanya waɗanda ke bi da ɗa'a kamar mãsu laifi?

verses.english: What is [the matter] with you? How do you judge?
verses.hausa: Me ya sãme ku, yãya kuke yin hukunci (da haka)?

verses.english: Or do you have a scripture in which you learn
verses.hausa: Ko kuna da wani littafi, wanda a cikinsa, kuke karantãwa?

verses.english: That indeed for you is whatever you choose?
verses.hausa: Cẽwã kunã da, a cikinsa lalle (duk) abin da rãyukanku suka zãɓa?

verses.arabic: أَمْ لَكُمْ أَيْمَـٰنٌ عَلَيْنَا بَـٰلِغَةٌ إِلَىٰ يَوْمِ ٱلْقِيَـٰمَةِ ۙ إِنَّ لَكُمْ لَمَا تَحْكُمُونَ
verses.english: Or do you have oaths [binding] upon Us, extending until the Day of Resurrection, that indeed for you is whatever you judge?
verses.hausa: Kõ kunã (riƙe) da wasu rantsuwõyin alkawari a kanMu, har ya zuwa Rãnar ¡iyãma, cẽwa lalle ne kunã da abin da kuke hukuntã wa kanku?

verses.english: Ask them which of them, for that [claim], is responsible.
verses.hausa: Ka tambaye su, wãne, a cikinsu, ke lãmuncewã ga sãmun wannan (hukuncin)?

verses.arabic: أَمْ لَهُمْ شُرَكَآءُ فَلْيَأْتُوا۟ بِشُرَكَآئِهِمْ إِن كَانُوا۟ صَـٰدِقِينَ
verses.english: Or do they have partners? Then let them bring their partners, if they should be truthful.
verses.hausa: Kõ sunã da abõkan tãrẽwa (ga wannan ra'ayi)? To, sai su kãwo abõkan tãrayyarsu, idan sun kasance mãsu gaskiya.

verses.arabic: يَوْمَ يُكْشَفُ عَن سَاقٍ وَيُدْعَوْنَ إِلَى ٱلسُّجُودِ فَلَا يَسْتَطِيعُونَ
verses.english: The Day the shin will be uncovered and they are invited to prostration but the disbelievers will not be able,
verses.hausa: Ranar da zã a kuranye ƙwabri, kuma a kira su zuwa ga yin sujũda, sai bã zã su iyãwa ba.

verses.arabic: خَـٰشِعَةً أَبْصَـٰرُهُمْ تَرْهَقُهُمْ ذِلَّةٌ ۖ وَقَدْ كَانُوا۟ يُدْعَوْنَ إِلَى ٱلسُّجُودِ وَهُمْ سَـٰلِمُونَ
verses.english: Their eyes humbled, humiliation will cover them. And they used to be invited to prostration while they were sound.
verses.hausa: Su fito da idãnu ƙasƙantattu, wulãkanci yana rufe su. Lalle ne a dã sun kasance anã kiran su zuwa, yin sujũdar, alhãli kuwa sunã lãfiya lau, (suka ƙi yi).

verses.arabic: فَذَرْنِى وَمَن يُكَذِّبُ بِهَـٰذَا ٱلْحَدِيثِ ۖ سَنَسْتَدْرِجُهُم مِّنْ حَيْثُ لَا يَعْلَمُونَ
verses.english: So leave Me, [O Muhammad], with [the matter of] whoever denies the Qur'an. We will progressively lead them [to punishment] from where they do not know.
verses.hausa: Sabõda haka ka bar Ni da mai ƙaryata wanna lãbãri (Alƙur'ãni). Zã Mu yi musu istidrãji daga inda ba su sani ba.

verses.english: And I will give them time. Indeed, My plan is firm.
verses.hausa: Ina jinkirtã musu, lalle kaidiNa mai ƙarfi ne.

verses.arabic: أَمْ تَسْـَٔلُهُمْ أَجْرًا فَهُم مِّن مَّغْرَمٍ مُّثْقَلُونَ
verses.english: Or do you ask of them a payment, so they are by debt burdened down?
verses.hausa: Kõ kana tambayar su wata la'ada ne, sabõda haka sũ, daga wannan tãrar, suke jin an nauyaya musu?

verses.english: Or have they [knowledge of] the unseen, so they write [it] down?
verses.hausa: Ko kuma sunã da ilmin gaibu ne, wãto sunã yin rubũtun (abin da suke faɗã daga gare shi) ne?

verses.arabic: فَٱصْبِرْ لِحُكْمِ رَبِّكَ وَلَا تَكُن كَصَاحِبِ ٱلْحُوتِ إِذْ نَادَىٰ وَهُوَ مَكْظُومٌ
verses.english: Then be patient for the decision of your Lord, [O Muhammad], and be not like the companion of the fish when he called out while he was distressed.
verses.hausa: Sabõda haka, ka yi haƙuri da hukuncin Ubangijinka, kada ka zama kamar Ma'abũcin kĩfi, alõkacin da ya yi kira, alhãli yana cike da hushi.

verses.arabic: لَّوْلَآ أَن تَدَٰرَكَهُۥ نِعْمَةٌ مِّن رَّبِّهِۦ لَنُبِذَ بِٱلْعَرَآءِ وَهُوَ مَذْمُومٌ
verses.english: If not that a favor from his Lord overtook him, he would have been thrown onto the naked shore while he was censured.
verses.hausa: Ba dõmin ni'ima daga wajen Ubangijinsa tã riske shi ba, lalle ne da an jẽfa shi a cikin wõfintacciyar ƙasa, alhãli yanã abin zargi.

verses.english: And his Lord chose him and made him of the righteous.
verses.hausa: Sai Ubangijinsa Ya zãɓe shi, sa'an nan Ya sanya shi a cikin mutãnen kirki.

verses.arabic: وَإِن يَكَادُ ٱلَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا۟ لَيُزْلِقُونَكَ بِأَبْصَـٰرِهِمْ لَمَّا سَمِعُوا۟ ٱلذِّكْرَ وَيَقُولُونَ إِنَّهُۥ لَمَجْنُونٌ
verses.english: And indeed, those who disbelieve would almost make you slip with their eyes when they hear the message, and they say, "Indeed, he is mad."
verses.hausa: Kuma lalle, ne waɗanda suka kãfirta sunã yin kamar su kãyar da kai sabõ da kallonsu (kallon mãmãki), a lokacin da suke jin karãtun Alƙur'ãni, kuma sunã cẽwa, "Lalle ne shi mahaukaci ne!"

verses.english: But it is not except a reminder to the worlds.
verses.hausa: Shi (Alƙur'ãni) bai kasance ba, fãce abin tunãtarwa ne ga duka dũniya.
